revised_title: The Effect of Touch on the Magnetic Properties of Needles
tldr: The author, Mr. Sellers, investigates whether touching a needle on a magnet can affect its ability to point to the true North and South. He finds that needles always conform to the magnetic meridian regardless of the touch, and that the nature of the steel and its temper play a significant role in its magnetic properties. He also claims to have successfully infused magnetic virtue into a piece of steel, allowing it to conform to the magnetic meridian without a load-stone.
